subject: Marketing
title: The Mere Exposure Effect
description: One-minute skill: The Mere Exposure Effect.

hook.text: You hear a song you hate. By the tenth listen, you're humming it.

buildup.text: Familiarity breeds liking. The more we encounter something, the more we prefer it.

discovery.text: This is the mere exposure effect, and advertisers use it relentlessly.

twist.text: It works even when you don't consciously notice the exposure.

climax.text: Brands spend billions on repetition not to inform you, but to become familiar.

quiz.question: Why do brands invest heavily in repeated advertising?
options: Familiarity breeds liking through mere exposure
People need to see facts many times to believe them
Repetition makes products cheaper to produce
